answers.answer: Dry mouth can be associated with a number of diseases such as diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, AIDS, bone marrow transplants, dehydration, depression, etc. Additionally, over 1800 drugs can make your mouth feel dry. Age plays a part too. We cannot see you nor apply tests over the internet to determine your cause. Try going to a doctor.
